Since 2018, he's been diving into the world of AWS and at the same time sharing what he's learned with others. After passing the AWS Certified Solutions Architect: Associate exam in 2019 he recorded multiple courses on serverless technologies, including Build an App with the AWS Cloud Development Kit, and Learn AWS Lambda from scratch.


In addition, he's active on his Twitter, blog - tlakomy.com, as well as The Practical Dev community, where he posts articles on career advice, testing and - of course - AWS.

name: Tomasz Ptak
description:
Tomasz is a software engineer with a focus on tackling technical challenges and helping deliver a developer experience that empowers teams to build great products and services. He is a senior software engineer at Duco, a cloud-based data reconciliation and integrity services provider which enables customers to efficiently consolidate, standardize, and reconcile any type of data. He also partners with AWS Hero Lyndon Leggate, and many AWS Community Builders, in co-leading the AWS Machine Learning Community.


Tomasz is a participant in the AWS DeepRacer League: a winner in the 2019 September virtual league race, and a 2019 and 2020 season finalist. He has been a leader in the AWS DeepRacer Community since day one, running the AWS DeepRacer Community Blog and knowledge base, and looking after AWS DeepRacer Community projects. He also works on promoting AWS DeepRacer as a learning opportunity in the United Kingdom and Poland. Finally, Tomasz enjoys blogging about his learning journey as a human, a professional in tech, and a hobbyist baker.

name: Tom McLaughlin
description:
Tom is a cloud infrastructure and operations engineer who has worked in companies ranging from startups to the enterprise. His areas of focus around serverless started largely on the operational aspects of building and running reliable serverless systems. More recently his efforts involve mentoring teams new to AWS and serverless, and helping them successfully adopt these technologies through training and education. Tom frequently shares his learnings on his blog, ServerlessOps.


What drew Tom early to serverless was the prospect of having no hosts or container management platform to build and manage which yielded the question: What would he do if the servers he was responsible for went away? As an early DevOps adopter he felt it was time to take a leap again into a new and emerging technology space. Hes found enjoyment in a community of people that are both pushing the future of technology and trying to understand its effects on the future of people and businesses.


Off the computer Tom races cars, dabbles in photography, sails, and is a devoted cat dad.

name: Tung Nguyen
description:
Tung Nguyen is the founder of BoltOps, a consulting company focused on AWS. Before starting BoltOps, he was the first employee and VPE at Bleacher Report, one of the largest sports sites in the world. He built and led the engineering team from startup to acquisition.


He has been using AWS since 2009 and is a bit of an AWS docs bookworm. Tung is a developer at heart, is passionate about DevOps, and has written several open source tools for AWS: ufo, lono, sonic, jack. The ufo tool is an ECS deployment tool that automates the process. He was a use-case speaker in the early days of Docker at the DockerCon keynote. Tung finds blogging therapeutic and writes about Docker, ECS and AWS on his Nuts and Bolts blog. He also creates video tutorials on his YouTube channel. Tung enjoys working with AWS and ECS because of its flexibility and ease. For companies interested in Docker and AWS, he is happy to help them get started.

name: Vanessa Santos
description:
Vanessa Santos joined the AWS User Group Sao Paulo in 2017. Starting from a non-traditional technical background, she became recognized as an AWS Community Leader in 2019, achieving new learnings and practices through the AWS re:Invent We Power Tech Grant.


Passionate about technology, Vanessa believes people can continuously learn and still be curious for more. She strives to invent and simplify ways to empower people to fulfill a human purpose, using tech skills to support their own communities, enabling ways to think bigger than ever, and creating impact as catalysts.


Vanessa works with local and international AWS User Groups as an AWS UG Sao Paulo co-organizer, with female and black tech communities, as an MBA Lecturer, and as council volunteer for Brazilian health tech. She has also worked at Brazilian AWS Consulting Partners, shifting roles as she expanded her tech skills, gathering certifications and supporting individual and company certification in multiple AWS Competencies. She currently works on the Global Segment Marketing team at Equinix.

name: Vicky Seno
description:
Vicky Tanya Seno is a Computer Science Professor at Santa Monica College, in Los Angeles California. At SMC she teaches numerous Amazon Web Services courses covering Computing Services, Containers, Kubernetes, ECS, Serverless, Networking and Security. Since accepting a faculty position at SMC in 2018, Vicky has helped develop a AWS Cloud Computing College Degree. Additionally, Vicky is part of a team that helps train and mentor faculty from nineteen local colleges in AWS, to help expand AWS course offerings in the Los Angeles area. She is also a co-organizer of AWS Cloud Day Conference at SMC that includes SA speakers, AWS workshops and a AWS CTF attended by over 130+ students at each event. #ProudToBeSMC


In 2019, AWS Educate appointed Vicky a AWS Cloud Faculty Ambassador for her contribution to AWS education in the classroom and the higher education community.


In an effort to increase female representation in this field, Vicky has been involved in various speaking and training activities. Vicky hosts a YouTube Channel with over 34,000 followers and 100+ beginners tech tutorials. She has also spoken at Amazon Summits on Containers, Kubernetes and Amazon EKS as well as developed training material for A Cloud Guru. Over the years, Vicky has given numerous coding workshops to elementary, middle and high school students, and has spoken on Women in STEM panels.


Before becoming a professor, Vicky worked over 20 years in IT with a focus on Linux Servers, High Performance Computing Clusters, Virtualization and AWS.

name: Vinicius Caridá
description:
Vinicius Carida (Vini) is a Computer Engineer with a Masters and PhD in Computer Science / Artificial Intelligence. He believes tech, data, & AI can impact people for a fairer and more evolved world. He loves to share his knowledge on AI, NLP, and MLOps on social media, on his YouTube channel, and at various meetups such as AWS User Group Sao Paulo where he is a community leader. Vini is also a community leader at TensorFlow Sao Paulo, an open source machine learning framework.


In addition to working with the community, Vini is Head of Digital Customer Service Platforms, PCP, WFM, Data, and AI at the largest bank in the Southern Hemisphere. He is also a Professor for MBA Machine Learning, Data, and BI programs at FIAP. He regularly participates in conferences and writes articles for different audiences (academic, scientific, technical), and different maturity levels (beginner, intermediate, and advanced).

name: Virginie Mathivet
description:
After earning a PhD on Neural Networks and Reinforcement Learning (when it was not so cool), Virginie taught AI for over 10 years to masters students. Her taste for vulgarization also led her to write her first book.


From 2017 to 2022, she established and led the Data Department at an IT firm, managing data initiatives. In 2023, she founded Hemelopse (pronounced MLOps), a consultancy dedicated to assisting businesses in formulating and executing their AI strategies.


Virginie regularly participates in conferences and writes books and articles, both for the public (introduction to AI) and for an informed audience (technical subjects). She also campaigns for a better visibility of women in the digital industry and for diversity in data professions. Her favorite cloud service? Amazon SageMaker of course!

name: Vishal Alhat
description:
Vishal Alhat is a senior software engineer at Forcepoint, a leading cybersecurity company, where he leverages his 9+ years of experience to play a key role in cloud-based deployments. He focuses on cloud security and DevOps using AWS, implementing DevOps tools, AWS services, and best practices to automate deployments and ensure consistency across Forcepoint's cloud infrastructure.


Passionate about sharing his knowledge, mentoring people, and fostering the AWS community, Vishal is an active and recognized leader. He was selected as the AWS Community Builder of the Year for the APJ region, a testament to his dedication. Vishal regularly speaks at international conferences, meetups, AWS Community Days, and summits worldwide. He's also the AWS User Group Pune leader, where his leadership extends beyond just organizing meetups. Vishal is known for his ability to effectively organize and speak at large-scale community events that inspire and educate.


Vishal's expertise lies in cloud security and DevOps on AWS. He frequently shares his learnings and insights by publishing articles on his blog and LinkedIn profile.

name: Vit Niennattrakul
description:
Vit Niennattrakul finished his Ph.D. in time series data mining and is also interested in machine learning, artificial intelligence, and natural language processing. He is a passionate technopreneur who founded startup companies: Stamp (an online-to-offline service provider), Triple-E (a data collection service provider), and Inspica (a data analytics solution provider). Those startup solutions are architected on AWS. He currently runs a company called DailiTech, the first Thai AWS consulting partner that helps partners and customers migrate to the cloud and deliver many born-in-the-cloud and hybrid-cloud solutions. Also, Vit is the first Thai-certified AWS Solution Architect - Professional and has also achieved other AWS certificates later on.


Vit started using AWS in 2013, sensing that AWS was the primary building block to drive innovations in Thailand. But they needed some help to unlock the path to success. They needed places to share and exchange knowledge with AWS users in Thailand. So he started building the AWS User Group (Thailand) with the help of his passionate team and AWS staff in December 2014. He and his team regularly organize meetups and collaborate with AWS on marketing events and seminars. Also, he encourages members to share their experiences and knowledge. In 2022 the community reached 10,000 members and continues to expand.

name: Vivek Raja P S
description:
Vivek is the VP of Product and founding member at NexStem, a leading provider of Brain Computer Interfacing solutions, acknowledged as a YourStory Tech30 startup and Nasscom Deeptech emerging startup. Recognized as the youngest AWS Machine Learning Hero, he has authored multiple research papers and recently in IIM-B and holds 2 patents in AI and IoT.


Vivek leads tech cloud communities in India such as AWS User Group Madurai, making an impact on over 5000 individuals. Proficient in multi-cloud environments, he holds a Guinness World Record. With an impressive track record of 20 hackathon wins and participation in over 60, Vivek is a sought-after technical speaker, engaging in more than 300 meet-ups and conferences. Additionally, he dedicates his time as a blogger, content creator, and hackathon mentor, inspiring individuals in the domains of Tech, AI, and Cloud.

name: Vlad Ionescu
description:
Vlad Ionescu jokingly describes himself as a Professional mistake avoider which he argues is a better way of saying Independent Consultant.


Vlad's work is focused on getting companies to high-performing levels, with a strong emphasis on developer experience.


Vlad swings wildly on the engineer/manager pendulum, and is always full of energy. As an Individual Contributor, he focuses on architecting resilient applications and upskilling engineers. As a Manager, he focuses on empowering people to do their best work and on building sustainable companies.


In parallel to his tech career, Vlad is a foodie and very much into cocktails, whiskey, and wine  finding him at a tasting or food pairing event is a sure bet. He cherishes mental health and is an avid proponent of any effort in the area.

name: Wendy Wong
description: Wendy is a Business Performance Analyst building data pipelines with AWS Analytics at Service NSW and agile projects in AI. Wendy previously worked as a Data Scientist and Consultant for an AWS Partner in presales data engineering and data science, a recruitment startup in NLP, data mining at ATO, higher education in Smart Cities and PwC Digital Academy.  Wendy was an industry mentor for Dalyell Scholars at the University of Sydney. As a teacher at heart, she enjoys sharing her passion as a Data Analytics Lead Instructor for General Assembly Sydney, writing technical blogs on dev.to. She is both an active speaker for AWS analytics and an advocate of diversity and inclusion, presenting at a number of events: AWS User Group Malaysia, Women Who Code, AWS Summit Australia 2022, AWS User Group BuildHers, AWS Innovate Modern Applications, and many more.

name: Wojciech Dąbrowski
description:
Wojciech has been an AWS User Group Silesia leader since 2019. During this time, he managed to organize multiple online and offline meetings. Besides that, he conducts workshops and presents cloud computing and software engineering topics.


He is fascinated by the pragmatic approach to software development and the iterative approach to building products and applications. Mainly he uses cloud-native solutions and willingly seeks innovation in his projects.


He helps organize other local initiatives by participating as a speaker, trainer, board member, or host.


Wojciech works as a Solutions and Cloud Architect, ensuring his organization uses the best practices regarding AWS Cloud management, developing applications in the cloud environment, designing new solutions, and improving existing ones.


Currently, he holds the role of AWS Capability Lead for Central Europe in Deloitte and is responsible for projects related to the AWS cloud in Central Europe.

name: Yan Cui
description:
Yan is an experienced engineer who has worked with AWS since 2009. He has been an architect and lead developer with a variety of industries ranging from banks and e-commerce to sports streaming and mobile games.


Yan is known for his serverless articles on Medium as well as his blog theburningmonk.com. Some of his work even made its way into the Serverless Well Architected whitepaper by AWS.


Yan is a polyglot in both spoken and programming languages. He is fluent in English and Mandarin, and counts C#, F#, Scala, Node.js, and Erlang amongst programming languages that he has worked with professionally.


Yan is a regular speaker at user groups and conferences internationally. He is also the author of Production-Ready Serverless where he tries to help others tackle operational challenges with serverless and adopt current leading practices.

name: Yan So
description:
Yan So is a senior data scientist with experience in applying big data machine learning to solve complex business challenges. He currently leads the Data team at Croquis Inc. and is in charge of improving personalized experiences and the recommendation system on AWS for their customers. He began his career as a software engineer with LG Electronics for 5 years, changing his career after getting a masters of data science at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.


He is a co-founder of the Data Science Group within the AWS Korea User Group (AWSKRUG) and has hosted over 30 meetups and AI/ML hands-on labs since 2017. He regularly speaks about interesting topics such as Amazon SageMaker GroundTruth at AWS Community Day, Zigzags Data Analytics Platform at AWS Summit Seoul, and a recommendation engine on Amazon Personalize at AWS Retail & CPG Day 2019. As a ML practitioner, he is interested in not only taking challenges to define and solve ML problems, but also exploring AWS AI/ML services to use in production workloads such as Amazon Sagemaker Studio.

name: Yasunori Kirimoto
description:
Yasunori Kirimoto is the Co-Founder and COO of MIERUNE Inc., a geospatial solution company. He specializes in the field of GIS(Geographic Information System) and FOSS4G(Free and Open Source Software for Geospatial).


Yasunori volunteers his time contributing to open source projects on GitHub. His latest contributions have been to AWS Geospatial, AWS Amplify, and AWS CDK.


His passion for cloud technologies and location services have lead him to publish numerous blog posts, drive community presentations on unique AWS cloud architectures, and even serve as a mentor to others in the field.

name: Yusuke Kuoka
description:
Yusuke Kuoka is a Software Development Engineer at freee K.K., leading the design and development of a highly available, scalable, and secure developer platform and infrastructure for microservices.


He maintains several OSS projects including kube-AWS (primary), Brigade, Helmfile, Habitus, and Awsbeats which he finds important for resolving real-world problems encountered while running production workloads on Kubernetes on AWS clusters.

name: Zainab Maleki
description:
Zainabs leadership skills have shone since arriving in Australia. Her volunteer experience at the Edmund Rice Centre was instrumental in her transition to her new life in Perth and, deciding to give back to the Centre, Zainab started a coding class for children of culturally diverse backgrounds in 2020. Zainab facilitated CoderDojo for girls for three years, which saw more than 100 girls participate in the program. She has also presented at a WiTWA event for school students and at the Big Day In event for over 500 students, motivating them to choose IT.


Zainab is also proud to share her experiences and expertise with the local and national tech communities. She has bravely stepped up to speak at numerous technical conferences starting with the TestWest 2016 motivating pair development. In 2018 she impressed the audience at the Latency Conference with her live demo, creating a production authentication platform in less than 10 minutes.


In 2020 Zainab presented reusable serverless patterns at the AWS Community Day and co-presented Design Driven Development in data and analytics at the Latency conference in Perth.


As a full-stack developer, Senior DevOps Engineer, AWS Ambassador and regular conference presenter Zainab is proud of the value that she has delivered to her clients and her community.
